Primary Purpose:

Provide research services, grant writing and administrative support to Director of the Cancer Research Institute.

Essential Job Functions:
  • Conduct basic and applied research using cell culture, animal models and human cancer samples.
  • Develop and write research proposals, submit grant applications and seek funding from both internal and external sources.
  • Develop independent research, write and publish research articles, research reports, research protocols and abstracts from data collected and analyzed.
  • Conduct drug discovery, cancer biomarkers or cancer genomics research.
  • Mentor junior scientists and research assistants
  • Prepare cells, plasma and other components from the blood samples, document details of the samples, store samples in liquid nitrogen, maintain inventory, prepare samples for shipment and shipping the samples.
  • Handle animals for experiments, implanting tumors, measure tumor size, administer drugs and other experimental compounds and all other procedures that are required for completion of experiments.
  • Perform cell culture of various cells including cancer cells, maintain the cells in culture, treat cells with drugs, prepare cell lysates for analysis and store cells in liquid nitrogen
  • Develop recombinant DNAs, recombinant DNA derived products and engineer production of antibody and growth factors using recombinant DNA technology.
  • Image mice, cells and other experimental subjects in the Night Owl imaging system, perform imaging using microscope imaging system, generate, analyze and interpret date from images.
  • Immunize animals and produce antibodies, purify antibodies, tap mice for antibody production, collect cells from ascites to freeze or re-inject.
  • Perform in vitro/in vivo cytotoxic assays, enzyme assays, drug screening, ELISA, PAGE, Western blots, Northern blots, Southern blots, PCR, RT-PCR, etc.
  • Maintain the water purification system, incubators, liquid nitrogen tanks, freezers, refrigerators etc.
  • Order, receive and maintain supplies, ensure appropriate inventory levels, maintain inventory
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Marginal Job Functions:

Supervise graduate and undergraduate students in the research laboratory.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge and experience for conducting laboratory research.
